skill.name: notion-meeting-intelligence
skill.description: Prepare meeting materials with Notion context and Codex research; use when gathering context, drafting agendas/pre-reads, and tailoring materials to attendees.
skill.summary: Prepare meeting materials with Notion context and Codex research; use when gathering context, drafti...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Static analyzer flagged 42 potential issues, all determined to be false positives. Network detections are legitimate MCP configuration URLs. External command detections are markdown code formatting for MCP tool names, not shell execution. High-severity C2 and crypto pattern detections are false positives triggered by hex hash strings in metadata. This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code.

content.value_statement: Meeting preparation requires gathering context from multiple sources and tailoring materials to attendees. This skill provides a structured workflow to search Notion for relevant context, select appropriate meeting templates, draft agendas, and enrich materials with research.
actual_capabilities: Search Notion for relevant context, past notes, and decision logs
Select appropriate meeting templates based on meeting type
Draft structured agendas with owners, timeboxes, and prep asks
Enrich agendas with Codex research including benchmarks and best practices
Create and update Notion pages for meeting materials
Guide MCP setup for Notion integration
limitations: Requires Notion MCP connection and Codex MCP for full functionality
Does not attend or transcribe meetings
Cannot access private Notion pages without proper authorization
Templates and workflows are guides, not automatic execution

use_cases.title: Prepare sprint planning meetings
use_cases.description: Gather context from previous sprint retrospectives, current backlog, and team capacity. Create a structured planning agenda with timeboxed story review sessions and clear sprint goals.
use_cases.target_user: Engineering team leads and project managers

use_cases.title: Create executive status updates
use_cases.description: Pull key metrics, blockers, and progress from Notion documentation. Format a concise status update highlighting wins, risks, and decisions needed for leadership review.
use_cases.target_user: Team leads and individual contributors reporting to leadership

use_cases.title: Facilitate decision meetings
use_cases.description: Research options with Codex to gather market data and benchmarks. Structure a decision document with pros, cons, risks, and recommendations for informed decision-making.

prompt_templates.title: Quick meeting prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me prepare a meeting for {meeting_type} with {attendees} on {date}. We need to achieve {outcome}. Search Notion for relevant context and draft an agenda.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a fast meeting preparation workflow

prompt_templates.title: Status update meeting
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a status update meeting for {stakeholders}. Search Notion for {project} progress, blockers, and key metrics from the last {time_period}. Draft an executive summary agenda.

prompt_templates.title: Planning session
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me plan a {meeting_type} for {team}. Use the planning template. Search Notion for relevant specs, OKRs, and past decisions. Include Codex research on {topic} best practices.
prompt_templates.scenario: When planning sprint, project, or quarterly planning sessions

prompt_templates.title: Decision meeting
prompt_templates.prompt: We need to make a decision about {decision_topic}. Research {option_a} vs {option_b} using Codex for market data and benchmarks. Search Notion for related decisions and constraints. Build a decision matrix.

output_examples.input: Prepare a sprint planning meeting for the frontend team on Monday. We have 3 engineers, 2 designers, and a PM. Goal is to commit to Q2 roadmap items.
Create a decision meeting for upgrading our database from PostgreSQL 12 to 16. Include research on migration risks.
output: - Migration risk: Medium (breaking changes in replication)

best_practices: Always confirm meeting goals, attendees, and required decisions before searching for context
Select the appropriate template based on meeting type to structure materials effectively
Include prep requests and timeboxes for each agenda item to keep meetings on track
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and creating agendas without relevant background
Using the wrong template type (e.g., brainstorming template for a status update)
Overloading agendas with too many topics without clear time allocation

faq.question: What if Notion MCP is not connected?
faq.answer: The skill will pause and provide setup instructions for adding the Notion MCP, enabling remote MCP client, and logging in with OAuth.

faq.question: Which meeting templates are available?
faq.answer: Templates include status update, decision meeting, sprint planning, retrospective, one-on-one, and brainstorming.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, the core workflow of gathering Notion context and drafting agendas works without Codex. Research enrichment features require Codex MCP.

faq.question: How do I customize templates?
faq.answer: Templates are located in the reference directory. Adapt sections to fit your specific meeting needs while maintaining the core structure.

faq.question: Does this skill create actual Notion pages?
faq.answer: Yes, it uses Notion MCP tools to create and update pages. You must have appropriate Notion workspace permissions.

faq.question: Can I use this for recurring meetings?
faq.answer: Yes, search for previous meeting notes in Notion to maintain continuity. The skill can help establish consistent agendas across meeting series.
